description: All activities aimed at maintaining accurate records of students and their administrative and academic statuses during their time at organisation, and managing the change of records and statuses.

elements.name: Enrolment Status Management
elements.description: What the organisation does to ensure the change of students' official statuses as members of the organisation in response to requests or changes in situation, and in accordance with the relevant regulations. This includes the abilities to interrupt/suspend studies for a period, withdraw from units of study, programmes of study and/or the organisation, and to transfer between units/modules of study.

elements.name: Programme Transfer Management
elements.description: What the organisation does to ensure a student's enrolment on one programme can be ceased, and enrolment onto an alternative programme performed, within limitations that may be imposed in terms of time, academic requirements, fees or other administrative reasons.

elements.name: Quercus
elements.description: main student administration system for the University

elements.description: Past Student records - nightly into archive warehouse?

Student Exceptional Factors Misconduct / Appeal Management
elements.description: What the organisation does to ensure it can receive and process student submissions relating to mitigating circumstances investigate and act in response to student misconduct, or allegations thereof, and handle subsequent formal challenges to those findings or actions. This includes ensuring the appropriate formal frameworks are in place for dealing with such situations. The term 'misconduct' can relate to academic offences, administrative discrepancies or behavioural conduct.

elements.name: Student Financial Administration
elements.description: What the organisation does to ensure that all aspects of student finance are effectively managed, including fee setting and collection and debtor management.

elements.name: Student Mobility
elements.description: What the organisation does to ensure students can study and enrol at different universities, either as part of their award at the originating organisation or as a permanent transfer to the other organisation, and, vice-versa, the ability to accept students from other universities in the same fashion.

elements.name: Student Record & Details Management
elements.description: What the organisation does to maintain accurate information about students, including contact, address and biographical details, and document management.This includes appropriate record retention and disposal management.
